title: Demographic IM definitions
description: The demographic model defines generic concepts of PARTY, ROLE and related details such as contact addresses. The archetype model defines the semantics of constraint on PARTYs, allowing archetypes for any type of person, organisation, role and role relationship to be described. This approach provides a flexible way of including the arbitrary demographic attributes allowed in the OMG HDTF PIDS standard.
$comments: Part of RM component, Release-1.0.3 version.

PARTY.title: PARTY
PARTY.description: Ancestor of all party types, including real world entities and their roles. A party is any entity which can participate in an activity. The name attribute inherited from LOCATABLE is used to indicate the actual type of party (note that the actual names, i.e. identities of parties are indicated in the identities attribute, not the name attribute).
PARTY.$comments: Defined in Demographic IM, abstract, inherits from LOCATABLE

name.description: Runtime name of this fragment, used to build runtime paths. This is the term provided via a clinical application or batch process to name this EHR construct: its retention in the EHR faithfully preserves the original label by which this entry was known to end users.

archetype_node_id.description:
Design-time archetype id of this node taken from its generating archetype; used to build archetype paths. Always in the form of an  at  code, e.g.  at0005 . This value enables a "standardised" name for this node to be generated, by referring to the generating archetype local ontology. 

At an archetype root point, the value of this attribute is always the stringified form of the archetype_id found in the archetype_details object.

links.description: Links to other archetyped structures (data whose root object inherits from ARCHETYPED, such as ENTRY, SECTION and so on). Links may be to structures in other compositions.

archetype_details.description: Details of archetyping used on this node.

feeder_audit.description: Audit trail from non-openEHR system of original commit of information forming the content of this node, or from a conversion gateway which has synthesised this node.

identities.description: Identities used by the party to identify itself, such as legal name, stage names, aliases, nicknames and so on.

details.description: All other details for this party.

reverse_relationships.description: Relationships in which this role takes part as target.

relationships.description: Relationships in which this role takes part as source.

CONTACT.title: CONTACT
CONTACT.description: Description of a means of contact of a party. Actual structure is archetyped.
CONTACT.$comments: Defined in Demographic IM, inherits from LOCATABLE

addresses.description: A set of address alternatives for this purpose and time validity.

time_validity.description: Valid time interval for this contact descriptor.

ADDRESS.title: ADDRESS
ADDRESS.description: Address of contact, which may be electronic or geographic.
ADDRESS.$comments: Defined in Demographic IM, inherits from LOCATABLE

PARTY_IDENTITY.title: PARTY_IDENTITY
PARTY_IDENTITY.description: An identity  owned  by a PARTY, such as a person name or company name, and which is used by the party to identify itself. Actual structure is archetyped.
PARTY_IDENTITY.$comments: Defined in Demographic IM, inherits from LOCATABLE

ROLE.title: ROLE
ROLE.description: Generic description of a role performed by an actor. The role corresponds to a competency of the party. Roles are used to define the responsibilities undertaken by a party for a purpose. Roles should have credentials qualifying the performer to perform the role.
ROLE.$comments: Defined in Demographic IM, inherits from PARTY

ACTOR.title: ACTOR
ACTOR.description: Ancestor of all real-world types, including people and organisations. An actor is any real-world entity capable of taking on a role.
ACTOR.$comments: Defined in Demographic IM, abstract, inherits from PARTY

CAPABILITY.title: CAPABILITY
CAPABILITY.description: Capability of a role, such as  ehr modifier ,  health care provider . Capability should be backed up by credentials.
CAPABILITY.$comments: Defined in Demographic IM, inherits from LOCATABLE

time_validity.description: Valid time interval for the credentials of this capability.

AGENT.title: AGENT
AGENT.description: Generic concept of any kind of agent, including devices, software systems, but not humans or organisations.
AGENT.$comments: Defined in Demographic IM, inherits from ACTOR

ORGANISATION.title: ORGANISATION
ORGANISATION.description: Generic description of organisations. An organisation is a legally constituted body whose existence (in general) outlives the existence of parties considered to be part of it.
ORGANISATION.$comments: Defined in Demographic IM, inherits from ACTOR

GROUP.title: GROUP
GROUP.description: A group is a real world group of parties which is created by another party, usually an organisation, for some specific purpose. A typical clinical example is that of the specialist care team, e.g.  cardiology team . The members of the group usually work together.
GROUP.$comments: Defined in Demographic IM, inherits from ACTOR

PERSON.$comments: Defined in Demographic IM, inherits from ACTOR

PARTY_RELATIONSHIP.title: PARTY_RELATIONSHIP
PARTY_RELATIONSHIP.description: Generic description of a relationship between parties.
PARTY_RELATIONSHIP.$comments: Defined in Demographic IM, inherits from LOCATABLE

VERSIONED_PARTY.title: VERSIONED_PARTY
VERSIONED_PARTY.$comments: Defined in Demographic IM, inherits from VERSIONED_OBJECT

uid.description: Unique identifier of this version container in the form of a UID with no extension. This id will be the same in all instances of the same container in a distributed environment, meaning that it can be understood as the uid of the  virtual version tree.

owner_id.description: Reference to object to which this version container belongs, e.g. the id of the containing EHR or other relevant owning entity.

time_created.description: Time of initial creation of this versioned object.
